718547f.folder: Centre Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY
718547f.text:
Centre Street, north from Park Row.
About 1885.
Brown Brothers.
718547f.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Park Row

718548f-a.folder: Centre Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY
718548f-a.text:
Centre Street & Park Row (convergence), showing the Municipal Building under construction in View 1, and completed in View 2. The photographers vantage point in both instances is City Hall Park. Note the enclosed over-pass to the
Brooklyn Bridge at the right.
No. 1: 1911
2: Sept., 1914
Ceorge L. Balgue
718548f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Park Row

718548f-b.text:
Centre Street & Park Row (convergence), showing the Municipal Building under construction in View 1, and completed in View 2. The photographers vantage point in both instances is City Hall Park. Note the enclosed over-pass to the

718548f-b.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Park Row

718549f-a.folder: Centre Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY
718549f-a.text:
Centre Street, north from Park Row. On the west sid of Centre Street, apnears the present Hall of Records. The Municial Building is
shovn on the right.
About 1925.
Brown Brothers.
718549f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Park Row

718550f-a.folder: Centre Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY
718550f-a.text:
Centre Street, at Park Row, showing prominently the Municipal B and the Manhattan Approach to the Brooklyn Bridge. In the foregrc appears the northeastern corner of City Hall Park with the Hall of opposite (left foreground). Across the East River looms the Brook
shore.
1936.
W.P.a. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
718550f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Park Row

718551f-a.folder: Centre Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY
718551f-a.text:
Centre Street (left) and Perk Row, northward, showing the Staats 2eitung Building. Upon this site rose the present Municipal Building. On the left is the fire enginr house in City Hall Park, separated by Chambers Street from the row of buildings, upon which site the Hall of Records was erected. Park Row on the right, appears prior to the erection of tho Third
Avenue 'E1.'
1870
Gift of Urbrock Collection
718551f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Park Row

718552f-a.folder: Centre Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY
718552f-a.text:
Centre Street, east side, north from Park Row. This view shows
the Staats-Zeitung Building.
About 1895.
Brown Brothers.
718552f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Park Row

718553f-a.folder: Centre Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY
718553f-a.text:
Centre Street (left) &. Park Row (right), northward from point on Nassau Street and across Frankfort Street. The Tryon Row Buildings were replaced by the Stats Zeitung Building, and which in turn was replaced by the Municipal Building. Note the spire of the St. Andrews R. C. Church across same. On the right is the 5 story building that housed Tammany Hall until it's acouisition in 1868 by the Sun. This structure is at the S. E. corner of Nassau and Frankfort Street's. The dark building beyond is Frenchs
Hotel (Pulitzer Building site).
Early 1860's
American Studio, photo
87 Nassau Street
Gift of the Urbrock Collection
REPRODUCTION RIGHTS UNKNOWN
718553f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Park Row

718556f-a.folder: Centre Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY
718556f-a.text:
Contre Street and Park Row convergence, northward across Chambers Street, showing the Municipal Building under construction. Park Row is on the right and has the "El" line there upon. Chambers Street is at the left and separates the new Hall of Records from the fire engine house in City Hall Park. Across the top are two of Manhattan's great bridges, the Manhattan, and the Williamsburg.
1912
Gift of Urbrock Collection
International News
718556f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Park Row

718959f-a.folder: Frankfort Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY
718959f-a.text:
City Hall Park: A view of the Citk Hall, as seen from Frankfort Street and viewing westward across Park Row. I1 the background appear the Postal Telegraph & Cable and the Home Life Insurance Company buildings; both on Broadway, at and adjoining the N.e4. corner of Murray Street. This is a
set consisting of two views.
About 1936.
Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad F.R.P.S.
718959f-a.title: Manhattan: Frankfort Street - Park Row

718959f-b.folder: Frankfort Street & Park Row, Manhattan, NY
718959f-b.text:
City Hall Park: A view of the Citk Hall, as seen from Frankfort Street and viewing westward across Park Row. I1 the background appear the Postal Telegraph & Cable and the Home Life Insurance Company buildings; both on Broadway, at and adjoining the N.e4. corner of Murray Street. This is a

721884f-a.folder: Nassau Street & Spruce Street, Manhattan, NY
721884f-a.text:
Nassau Street, east side, at Spruce Street. The view also shows Spruce Street, south side, at Nassau Street. I the foreground is a portion of Printing House Square, with a statue of Benjamin Franklin. On the left is the old Tribune Building and the former Times Building is on the right.
About 1905.
Brown Brothers.

721885f-a.folder: Nassau Street & Spruce Street, Manhattan, NY
721885f-a.text:
Nassau Street, south from but nct including Spruce Street.
June S, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

721886f-a.folder: Nassau Street & Spruce Street, Manhattan, NY
721886f-a.text:
Nassau Street, east side, north from but not including Spruce, to and includin; Frankfort Stroets. Also shown is Park Row, east side, north from Spruce Street, to and including the Brooklyn Bridge Approach, (near North William Street). The view shows the Pulitzer (Wbrld) Puilding adjoining the 3ridge Approach, with a statue of Benjamin Franklin in the foreground ac the intersection of Nassau Street and Park Row.
June 24, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

721887f-a.folder: Nassau Street & Spruce Street, Manhattan, NY
721887f-a.text:
Nassau Street, east side, trom Spruce (right) to FrankTort (left) Streets, showing the buildings identified with this locale, Printing House Scuare. From right to left, these are, the Times Building (erected 1888), the Tribune Building (erected 187O's), the Sun Building ( Chas. A. Dana became editor in 18bB and transfered here), and the Pulitzer (World) Building (erected 1888-9). At the left margin appears 6 portion oI the City Hall and the Brooklyn Bridge train shed. The trees in the foreground are in City Hall Park.
About 1891
Thru New York Historical Society

721888f.folder: Nassau Street & Spruce Street, Manhattan, NY
721888f.text:
Nassau Street, east side, from Spruce (right) to Frankfort (left) Streets, showing structures lining Printing House Square, as photographed from City Hall Park. The Tribune Building is the dominant feature with the clock tower. On the left is Frenchs Hotel. This will be replaced shortly with the Pulitzer (World) Building. The five-story Sun Building separates these items. In the margins, left and right respectively, are City Hall, and the Times Building (under construction).
"inter 1888-9
Thru New York Historical Society

722438f-a.folder: Park Row & Spruce Street, Manhattan, NY
722438f-a.text:
Park Row, east side, south from and including Spruce Street, to but not including Broadway. Also shown is Nassau Street, west side, south from and including Spruce Street. The view is taken from the Municipal Puilding, and shows a portion of City Hall Park in the foreground.
June 23, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
722438f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Spruce Street

722439f.folder: Park Row & Spruce Street, Manhattan, NY
722439f.text:
Park Row, east side, south from and including Spruce 3treot, to and including Broadway. Also shown is Nassau Street, east side, south from and including Spruce, to and including Fulton Streets. The view shows the New York Times Building, at the intersection of Park Pow, and Sassau Street, and the rear of the General Post Office on Mail Street. In the foreground is seen a portion of City Hall Park, while in the background, and at the termination of Park Row, is seen St. Paul's
Protestant Episcopal Chapel.
About 1870.
Brown Brothers.
Niea ~ w50
722439f.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Spruce Street

722440f-a.folder: Park Row & Spruce Street, Manhattan, NY
722440f-a.text:
Park Row, north from and including Spruce Street. The view shows (from left to right), the N. Y. City Hall, Hall of Records, the Municipal Building, the N. Y. Herold Building, the Pulitzer (Aorld) Building, Tribune Building and the Potter(Times) Building. Bridge shown in the foreground, across Park Row, is an extension from the Brooklyn Bridge Station of the
Second and Third Aves., Elevated Lines.
About 1927.
New York Edison Co.  Yneo w G5
722440f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Spruce Street

722441f.folder: Park Row & Spruce Street, Manhattan, NY
722441f.text:
Park Row, north from Spruce Street and showing prominently the Municipal Building (Centre Street and Park Row) under construction. On the left is City Hall Park; a rear view of the 5-story City Court and the new Hall of Records. The enclosed bridge structure provided access to the Brooklyn Bridge and its transportation facilities.
About 1910
Ewing Galloway
722441f.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Spruce Street

722442f-a.folder: Park Row & Spruce Street, Manhattan, NY
722442f-a.text:
Park Row, east side, at Spruce Street, as seen across City Hall Park. The view shows a portion of the General Post Office on the right.
June 24, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

722442f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Spruce Street

722445f-a.folder: Park Row & Frankfort Street, Manhattan, NY
722445f-a.text:
(1)
Park Row, north from Frankfort Street, to the Brooklyn Bridge. The view shows the Brooklyn Bridge Extension of the Second and Third Avenue Elevated, over Park Row, to City Hall Park. Prominent in the background, is the Municipal Building. On the right appears the
World (Pulitzer) Building.
April 18, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view.
April 18, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same area subsequent to the removal of the aforementioned pedestrian over-approach to the Bridge. Remaining is the "El" station and the train shed from which formerly all Brooklyn traffic started. Beyond same is the New York Herald building and statuette on North William Street. Note the automobile entrance to the Bridge adjoining
the World Building.
July 4, 1938.
722445f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Frankfort Street

722445f-c.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Frankfort Street

722446f-a.folder: Park Row & Frankfort Street, Manhattan, NY
722446f-a.text:
Park Row, east side, north from and including Frankfort Street, to and including The Brooklyn Bridge Approach, near North William Street. Also shown is Nassau Street, at and adjoining the S.E. corner of Frankfort Street. In the foreground, is shown a portion of City Hall Park, with a part of the City Hall. The Municipal Building is seen towering above the Second and Third Aves., Elevated Brooklyn Bridge Station extension. Adjoining said station on the south, is the Pulitzer Building, (also known as the "world Building"). A portion of the Tribune Building, is shown on
the extreme right.
About 1925.
722446f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Frankfort Street

722447f-a.folder: Park Row & Frankfort Street, Manhattan, NY
722447f-a.text:
Park Row, east side, south from and including Frankfort Street, to, but not including Broadway. Also shown is Nassau Street, south from
Park Row, to and including Fulton Street.
About 1894.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.  kg w G52
722447f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Frankfort Street

722448f-a.folder: Park Row & Frankfort Street, Manhattan, NY
722448f-a.text: General View:  Park Row and Frankfort Street.  From the Pulitzer Building looking south.  Beadles Island and the Statue of Liberty are discernible at right, facing the Jersey Shore.
722448f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Frankfort Street

722449f-a.folder: Park Row & Frankfort Street, Manhattan, NY
722449f-a.text:
Park Row, east side, at Frankfort Street, as seen from across City Hall Park. The view shows a portion of the City Hall on the right and the Pulitzer Building (also known as the "World" Building.) in the
background.
About 1899.
Ewing Galloway.

the background.
June 24, 1933.

722460f-a.text:
